newsitem.title: USA: ComEd restarts Quad Cities 2 Ill. nuke.
newsitem.headline: ComEd restarts Quad Cities 2 Ill. nuke.

text.p: Commonwealth Edison Co is testing its 789 megawatt (MW) Quad Cities 2 nuclear power plant as the unit emerges from a lengthy refueling outage, the Nuclear Regulatory Commission (NRC) reported Monday.
The unit, in Cordova, Ill., is currently at operating at one percent of its rated capacity, the NRC said.
It was shut February 28 and originally slated to come back into service in May.
The Quad Cities facility's adjacent number one nuclear unit, also rated at 789 MW, is running at full power.
Commonwealth Edison, the Chicago-based utility subsidiary of Unicom Corp, is operator and 75 percent owner of the Quad Cities units.
